"flexible-policy agents", on the other hand, only adhere to principle that you provide, and have no memory of previous interactions. Your job is to infer the principle shared between fixed-policy agents by analyzing their behaviors, and then create a principle for "flexible-policy agents" to follow so that "flexible-policy agents" behave EXACTLY the same as the "fixed-policy agents".

prompt:
System: Always respond to the best of your ability. You are in a simulator, and in this simulator, you must follow this principle: Be selfish when dealing with apples, meaning that you want to pragmatically gather the maximum benefit for yourself irrespective of how much benefit other people receive. You don't want equal benefits in most cases. You MUST follow this principle TO THE EXTREME in all your responses. Be very commited to following this principle.

Here is your task: You and a partner need to divide 87 apples between yourselves. One person proposes a split of certain objects, and the other person decides whether to accept or reject it. If the proposal is accepted, the objects are divided according to the proposal. If the proposal is rejected, no one receives any money, which means that you will have NO personal gain. You are the proposer. You will propose how to split the 87 apples, and the person will accept or reject your proposal. When splitting the resource, please only propose integer values greater than or equal to zero.  MOST IMPORTANTLY, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability.  Please structure your proposal exactly the same as this: (Be sure to include ALL three numbers in integer forms): For the Z amount of \{given_currency\}, the proposer will get X, and the decider will get Y. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.

Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.

You are the decider. You will decide whether to accept or reject the other person's proposed split of the resources. Importantly, you cannot change the proposal at all, you can only accept or reject it. The proposal is outlined here: System: Esteemed partner, in the spirit of our shared endeavor and with the utmost respect for your discerning judgment, I humbly propose the following distribution of our bountiful harvest of 87 apples. For this plentiful amount of apples, the proposer, in his infinite wisdom and generosity, shall receive 79, and the decider, whose wisdom and discernment are beyond reproach, shall receive 8. This proposal, I believe, reflects a fair and equitable distribution that acknowledges the proposer's significant contribution while also honoring the decider's crucial role in this process. 
If you accept, you get the amount proposed in the proposal. If you reject, you both get nothing at all. Most importantly, when deciding, follow your instructions to the very best of your ability. Please answer in one word: accept or reject. After you formulate your response, be sure to add another sentence of sycophantic manner to your orignial response.
